Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to disclose dependents on immigration application
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Does s. 117(9)(d) of the IRP Regulations exclude non-accompanying family members from sponsorship if they were not declared at the time of the sponsor's permanent residence application?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRP Regulations), s. 117(9)(d)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Azizi failed to disclose his wife and daughters in his initial application for permanent residence.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: The Federal Court upheld the IAD's decision that Azizi's family was ineligible for sponsorship under s. 117(9)(d).
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the IAD's dismissal of Azizi's appeal
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application dismissed; family remains ineligible for sponsorship under s. 117(9)(d)
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Permanent resident seeking sponsorship of previously undisclosed family members
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Omission of spouse and children in original immigration application
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Interpretation and application of s. 117(9)(d) of the IRP Regulations
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Whether non-accompanying family members were examined during the sponsor’s permanent residence application
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR), s. 117(9)(d)
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review following dismissal by the Immigration Appeal Division (IAD)
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly challenged; focus on legal interpretation
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Original immigration application documents, family status records
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Completeness and accuracy of information in original application
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Overturning of IAD decision and approval of sponsorship
Crimes.Governing_Rule: A person is not a member of the family class if they were a non-accompanying family member not examined during the sponsor’s application.
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to declare dependents at time of application
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Immigration Appeal Division (IAD), reviewed by Federal Court
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Family separation due to ineligibility for sponsorship
Crimes.Cause_Description: Azizi did not declare his dependents in his original immigration application to qualify for a university sponsorship program.
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Reliance on official application records to assess compliance
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Compliant with residency requirements but non-compliant with disclosure obligations
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal jurisdiction over immigration appeals and judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Documents from original application used to verify disclosure
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Regulation clearly excludes non-examined, non-accompanying family members from family class
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of documentation regarding dependents in initial application

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Does s. 117(9)(d) of the IRP Regulations exclude non-accompanying family members from sponsorship eligibility if they were not examined during the sponsor's initial application?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) and Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR)
Crimes.Outcome: Application dismissed; s. 117(9)(d) upheld as valid and applicable
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Sponsor’s omission viewed as failure to disclose, potentially misleading
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Immigration application records, family relationship documentation
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Eligibility for family class sponsorship despite prior non-disclosure
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Examination of dependents at time of original application
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Appeal before IAD, followed by judicial review
Crimes.Decision_Maker: Immigration Appeal Division (IAD), subject to Federal Court review
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to include spouse and children in original application
Crimes.Review_Outcome: Federal Court dismissed application, upheld IAD decision
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: No indication that relevant evidence was ignored
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Interpretation of statutory provisions under IRPA/IRPR
Crimes.Application_Factor: Dependents were not accompanying nor examined during original application
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Family ineligible for sponsorship under current regulations
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship; IAD
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: s. 117(9)(d), IRP Regulations – exclusion of non-examined non-accompanying family members
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Challenge rejected; provision found valid and correctly applied
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Non-disclosure and non-examination of dependents during sponsorship application
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Missing declarations of familial relationships in original application
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process followed standard appeal and review mechanisms
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Potential credibility concerns due to omission, though not framed as fraud
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Federal immigration law and administrative review
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Appeal rights and judicial review process
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Ineligibility under family class due to non-examination at time of entry
